original_solution_mapping.L1: A leap year is one day shorter than a regular year, so it is 365 - 1 = <<365-1=364>>364 days.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Brittany washes her hair every other day, so she will wash it 364 / 2 = <<364/2=182>>182 times in a leap year.
original_solution_mapping.L3: A bottle of shampoo lasts her 14 / 1 / 4 = 14 * 4 = 56 washes.
original_solution_mapping.L4: If she buys 3 bottles, she will only have enough for 56 * 3 = <<3*56=168>>168 washes.
original_solution_mapping.L5: If she buys 4 bottles, she will have enough for 56 * 4 = <<4*56=224>>224 washes.
original_solution_mapping.L6: Since 168 < 182 and 224 > 182, Brittany needs 4 bottles of shampoo to get her through a leap year.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4593.
    Returns: the number of shampoo bottles Brittany needs.
    """
    # L1
    days_in_regular_year = 365 # WK
    days_shorter_leap_year = 1 # WK
    days_in_leap_year = days_in_regular_year - days_shorter_leap_year

    # L2
    wash_frequency_divisor = 2 # WK
    num_washes_leap_year = days_in_leap_year / wash_frequency_divisor

    # L3
    bottle_size_ounces = 14 # 14-ounce bottles
    shampoo_per_wash_numerator = 1 # 1/4 ounce of shampoo
    shampoo_per_wash_denominator = 4 # 1/4 ounce of shampoo
    washes_per_bottle = bottle_size_ounces / shampoo_per_wash_numerator / shampoo_per_wash_denominator

    # L4
    test_bottles_1 = 3 # WK
    washes_with_3_bottles = washes_per_bottle * test_bottles_1

    # L5
    test_bottles_2 = 4 # WK
    washes_with_4_bottles = washes_per_bottle * test_bottles_2

    # L6
    # FA
    answer = test_bottles_2
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: A leap year is one day shorter than a regular year, so it is {days_in_regular_year} - {days_shorter_leap_year} = <<{days_in_regular_year}-{days_shorter_leap_year}={days_in_leap_year}>>{days_in_leap_year} days.

Brittany washes her hair every other day, so she will wash it {days_in_leap_year} / {wash_frequency_divisor} = <<{days_in_leap_year}/{wash_frequency_divisor}={num_washes_leap_year}>>{num_washes_leap_year} times in a leap year.

A bottle of shampoo lasts her {bottle_size_ounces} / {shampoo_per_wash_numerator} / {shampoo_per_wash_denominator} = {bottle_size_ounces} * {shampoo_per_wash_denominator} = {washes_per_bottle} washes.

If she buys {test_bottles_1} bottles, she will only have enough for {washes_per_bottle} * {test_bottles_1} = <<{test_bottles_1}*{washes_per_bottle}={washes_with_3_bottles}>>{washes_with_3_bottles} washes.
If she buys {test_bottles_2} bottles, she will have enough for {washes_per_bottle} * {test_bottles_2} = <<{test_bottles_2}*{washes_per_bottle}={washes_with_4_bottles}>>{washes_with_4_bottles} washes.
Since {washes_with_3_bottles} < {num_washes_leap_year} and {washes_with_4_bottles} > {num_washes_leap_year}, Brittany needs {test_bottles_2} bottles of shampoo to get her through a leap year.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: A leap year is one day shorter than a regular year, so it is 365 - 1 = <<365-1=364>>364 days.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Brittany washes her hair every other day, so she will wash it 364 / 2 = <<364/2=182>>182 times in a leap year.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: A bottle of shampoo lasts her 14 / 1 / 4 = 14 * 4 = 3.5 washes.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: If she buys 3 bottles, she will only have enough for 3.5 * 3 = <<3*3.5=10.5>>10.5 washes.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: If she buys 4 bottles, she will have enough for 3.5 * 4 = <<4*3.5=14>>14 washes.

explanation: Incorrect final answer. An intermediate value 'washes_with_4_bottles' (value: 14.0) was reported instead of 'test_bottles_2' (value: 4).
